title: FR: Mobile friendly interface
body:
#### General information
Lollipop

* **App version:** 
1.3.13

* **System:** 
Debian Wheezy

#### Description
HI

Is it possible to make this a app abit more phone screen size friendly? Everything is very small atm. It would be nice if the mobile version rescales the ui and offers bigger fonts.


thanks

title: WebView content get lost after device rotation
body:
#### General information

* **App version:** 
v1.3.12 (25) 
* **System:** 
Android 6, Nexus 4

#### Description
Open app, rotate device twice.

The green ball at the right bottom part of the screen disappear, thus I can't do anything with the app.

![screen shot 2018-04-12 at 10 06 08 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38213896/38682617-20ab1f4e-3e9e-11e8-8947-bcc672c2feee.png)

Screenshot after the rotation

title: Add PT-BR and PT-PT translations (#8) by @TiagoDanin
body:
Reference issue #8
-------

Necessary:
- [x] Check language code: PT-rBR or PT-BR

NOTE: Only the word "Registry" is written differently between languages (PT-PT `Registos` and PT-BR `Registro`).

title: Support download of files from WebView
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Currently there is no popup or like that asking for download when clicking on something downloadable in android webview. Resolving this will show such a dialog and will save the files in to device external Downloads folder. You need to also ask for EXTERNAL_STORAGE / check permission before saving (marshmallow permissions).

For Kimai you can create an demo account ( it's just one click, no need to enter details) at <https://demo.kimai.org/status.php> (and enter the generated account details in app settings) , goto export in the web menu, select an entry and click e.g. PDF. On desktop this then opens a download dialog for the invoice.pdf, on kimai-android app there is no such thing, nothing happens currently.

title: New kimai-android strings translatable
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
This issue will be used to notify translators of the app. Please subscribe to this issue if you want to start translating or already translated something and want to keep the strings updated for some language.

You can use e.g. [Stringlate](https://f-droid.org/packages/io.github.lonamiwebs.stringlate/) to contribute translations - directly on your phone.

 [![Translate - with Stringlate](https://img.shields.io/badge/stringlate-translate-green.svg)](https://lonamiwebs.github.io/stringlate/translate?git=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fgsantner%2Fkimai-android.git&name=kimai-android&web=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fgsantner%2Fkimai-android) 


List of translators on GitHub (unified across @gsantner projects):
* German - @gsantner
* French - @milouse, @Poussinou, @Quent-in, @SansPseudoFix, @gbaudic
* Russian - @xredor, @guland2000
* Spanish - @larjona, @Lonami, @AlexandreInsua
* Italian - @simocosimo, @Daraf-IT, @xDarkWolf
* Brazilian - @luisfsr, @TiagoDanin
* Swedish - @spitlo
* Turkish - @mobile46
* Polish - @kRkk, @pskosinski, @Bjornskjald
* Ukrainian - @cl0ne, @Abrasha
* Hindi - @kartikarora
* Japanese - @naofum
* Sardinian - @asereze
* Greek - @nicolasmanic
* Dutch - @TopdRob
* Indonesian - @freedomofkeima
* Hungarian - @maxigaz

title: Fix Link To F-Droid And Add Google Play Badge
Kimai-mobile compatibility?
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Hi,

Would it be possible to make Kimai-android compatible with Kimai-mobile? ( http://www.kimai.org/kimai-mobile/ ) That would make a perfect match imho. It would even be better if there is a facility to switch between the two, so standard start-stop can be done from the mobile interface and more advanced tasks from the advanced interface.

Thanks a lot!

Winfried
